content.rendered:
I was curious to see what would happen if I typed random words on my Notes app keyboard, and this is what I got.

“Hi there, I was thinking of your thoughts on your Christmas party and we will probably never have a chance to look at our house. I don’t know if you have any other or because I don’t want to be a normal person, but if you don’t care, what you do and you don’t know what you want, to do with me.

Merry birthday girl. I just wanted you and your friend that I was going to be able to come over and help. I have a lot of money. I just got home. I don’t think you could be there in any case, but I just got a new dress. I just wanted you know I had some ideas.

I have to be there. I don’t think you could have anything else for us that would help you out and we will focus our own things that are you going through to our own family.

His disciples are also in the front. Maybe you can do it tomorrow. I have had to pay a little while for the first two weeks of this. Merrily is the day that we can choose to focus on our own way to our fear of ourselves.

Meet us there at our church. If you are looking for a good game, you can learn more about it and then you can find something new. Happy big or how small it would be.”

It doesn’t really make sense, but that’s how it is, some times, when you try something new or different. There are going to be people who don’t understand what you are trying to do, and there are going to be people who say that if it could be done, it would have been done already.

Some times the best thing to do is to thank others for their advise/opinion, and go ahead and do what you were going to do, anyway, whether others understand or not. If the Hadron Collider hasn’t brought about the end of the world, you trying something new probably won’t, either. And even if you fail, you can still learn something from your mistakes.
